TestCase.TestCase_Title: Drag'n'drop from Orchestra Explorer to Eclipse-based tool

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: From the Windows file explorer, create the D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Artefacts directory
Create a D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Artefacts\Dir1 directory
In the Dir1 directory, create Powerpoint files : A.ppt, C.ppt and one Text file B.txt, with five slides per Powerpoint slide
Create a D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Artefacts\Dir2 directory
In the Dir2 directory, create one Powerpoint file E.ppt and two Text files D.txt and F.txt, with five slides per Powerpoint slide
From the Windows file explorer, create the D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Mozart directory
In the Orchestra Framework, create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Unfold the "AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Click on the "Orchestra" category
In the variable viewer, add the FileSystem directory "D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Artefacts" to the "ArtefactPath" variable and clic to "Finish" button twice
In the variable viewer, add the path to "ConfdirOrchestraFramework" confdir to the "ConfigurationDirectories" variable
In the variable viewer, add the path to "ConfdirOffice" confdir to the "ConfigurationDirectories" variable
In the variable viewer, add the path to "ConfdirMozart" confdir to the "ConfigurationDirectories" variable
In the variable viewer, add the FileSystem directory "D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Mozart" to the "ArtefactPath" variable and clic to "Finish" button twice
Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
In the context viewer, right click on the "AdminContext" context and select "Set as current context"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the context viewer, the "AdminContext" is displayed in bold
Orchestra Explorer displayable within an Eclipse-based tool

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Launch the "Mozart" tool

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The Orchestra Explorer is embedded within Mozart and displayed by default on the left

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create a new project on Mozart with default values in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Mozart, clic to the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Icons are shared with the Orchestra Framework

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the Orchestra Explorer, click on the top right bottom arrow and select "Group by" > "Type"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The Orchestra Explorer shows three artefact types : Mozart, Poweroint and Text

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Unfold the "Powerpoint" artefact type

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Three artefacts are dispalyed : Dir1/A, Dir1/C, Dir2/E

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Unfold the "Text" artefact type

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Three artefacts are dispalyed : Dir1/B, Dir2/D, Dir2/F
Drag'n'drop an artefact

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Drag artefact "Dir1/B" from the Orchestra Explorer and drop it in the Mozart Fragment viewer

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An entry "[Not Extracted] - Dir1/B" has been added to the fragment list

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Drag artefact "Dir2/E" from the Orchestra Explorer and drop it in the Mozart Fragment viewer

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An entry "[Not Extracted] - Dir2/E" has been added to the fragment list
Drag'n'drop artefact set

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the Orchestra Explorer, switch to folding mode

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the top tree, three artefact types : Mozart, Poweroint and Text

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the top tree, unfold the "Powerpoint" artefact type

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Two folders are displayed : Dir1 and Dir2

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the top tree, click on the "Dir1" directory

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The bottom tree shows two artefacts: A and C

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Drag artefact directory "Dir1" of Powerpoint type from the Orchestra Explorer and drop it in the Mozart Fragment viewer

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A "Artefacts set parameters" wizard pops up

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Select both "Powerpoint" and "Text" artefact types and click on the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An entry "[Not Extracted] - Dir1 (LogicalFolderPath=Dir1, RootTypes=Powerpoint|$|Text)" has been added to the fragment list

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the Mozart Fragment viewer, right click on the "[Not Extracted] - Dir1 (LogicalFolderPath=Dir1, RootTypes=Powerpoint|$|Text)" entry and select "Extract" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "[Not Extracted] - Dir1 (LogicalFolderPath=Dir1, RootTypes=Powerpoint|$|Text)" is replaced with "Dir1 (LogicalFolderPath=Dir1, RootTypes=Powerpoint|$|Text)"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the Mozart Fragment viewer, click on "Dir1 (LogicalFolderPath=Dir1, RootTypes=Powerpoint|$|Text)" and select "Extract" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Three artefacts are displayed: Dir1/A, Dir1/B, Dir1/C

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on artefact "Dir1/A"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Five sub-artefact Slides are displayed

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the Dir1 directory, create a new H.txt text file
In the Mozart Fragment viewer, click on "Dir1 (LogicalFolderPath=Dir1, RootTypes=Powerpoint|$|Text)" and select "Extract" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Three artefacts are displayed: Dir1/A, Dir1/B, Dir1/C, Dir1/H
